config_description: Defensive settings for protecting Cassandra from true network partitions. See (CASSANDRA-14358) for details.  The amount of time to wait for internode tcp connections to establish.
developer_understanding_on_working: The tcpConnectTimeoutInMS method returns the value of tcpConnectTimeoutInMS if it is not null, otherwise it retrieves the value from DatabaseDescriptor.getInternodeTcpConnectTimeoutInMS(). The getInternodeTcpConnectTimeoutInMS method simply returns the value from DatabaseDescriptor.getInternodeTcpConnectTimeoutInMS().
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms configuration depends on when the tcpConnectTimeoutInMS method is called in the code. It will be triggered whenever the tcpConnectTimeoutInMS method is invoked.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms configuration option is related to the amount of time to wait for internode tcp connections to establish. Setting this value too low may result in failed connections or timeouts, while setting it too high may increase latency in establishing connections.
